Package it.polimi.ingsw.View.GUI.Application

Class IslandTilePane

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.layout.Region
javafx.scene.layout.Pane
javafx.scene.layout.StackPane
it.polimi.ingsw.View.GUI.Application.IslandTilePane
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class IslandTilePane extends javafx.scene.layout.StackPane
This class models an island tile. The archipelago has a number of these tiles and can iterate through them and move them around as a whole. A tile actually contains the background image, a pane for island modifiers (pawns that apply an effect on the tile) and a student pane.

    Methods inherited from interface javafx.css.Styleable

    getStyleableNode

  • Field Details

    • partyMode

      public static final boolean partyMode
      Boolean that activates/deactivates the party mode. When in party mode, island tiles have one additional skin and are randomly rotated.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • IslandTilePane

      public IslandTilePane(int index)
      Creates the island background image (has a different outcome if partyMode is set to true), and creates the (initially empty) modifier pane.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of this tile inside the archipelago

  • Method Details

    • createIslandTile

      public void createIslandTile(int ID)
      Creates the student pane on this tile with its associated list of free spots.
      Parameters:
      ID - the StudentContainer ID of the student pane

    • updateTower

      public void updateTower(TowerColor towerColor)
      Updates the color of the tower placed on this tile.
      Parameters:
      towerColor - the updated tower color

    • updateMotherNature

      public void updateMotherNature(boolean isMotherNatureHere)
      Updates the presence of mother nature on this tile. Simply sets the mother nature pawn to invisible if it is not present.
      Parameters:
      isMotherNatureHere - true if mother nature sits on this tile, false otherwise

    • updateNoEntryTile

      public void updateNoEntryTile(int numOfNoEntryTiles)
      Updates the presence and number of no-entry tiles on this island tile. If there are no no-entry tiles, the associated icon is simply set to invisible.
      Parameters:
      numOfNoEntryTiles - the number of no-entry tiles on this island tile

    • updateStudents

      public void updateStudents(List<Integer> newStudents, HashMap<Integer,Color> studColor)
      Updates the number and position of students on this tile. Note that this method only adds students to islands because in the current implementation of this game students are never removed from them.
      Parameters:
      newStudents - a list of student IDs
      studColor - a hash map of the colors associated with each student ID

    • getStudents

      public List<StudentView> getStudents()
      Returns a list of the ImageViews of each student present on this island.
      Returns:
      a list of student ImageViews that are present on this island

    • getForwardMergePoint

      public javafx.geometry.Point2D getForwardMergePoint()
      Calculates and returns the forward merge point of this island tile.
      Returns:
      the forward merge point of this tile

    • getBackMergePoint

      public javafx.geometry.Point2D getBackMergePoint()
      Calculates and returns the backwards merge point of this island tile.
      Returns:
      the backwards merge point of this tile

    • getCenter

      public javafx.geometry.Point2D getCenter()
      Calculates and returns the center of this island tile.
      Returns:
      the center point of this tile
